questions.text: Of the following which is a city in Mexico?
questions.explanation:
Ecatepec.

	Full name, Ecatepec de Morelos, it was an Aztec city and is now an industrial centre; Esfahân is a city in Iran; El Alto is a city in Bolivia; and, Eloy Alfaro is in Ecuador.

questions.text: Which of the following is a city in the Dominican Republic?
questions.explanation:
Esperanza.

	Esperanza is a city in the Dominican Republic; El-Jadida and Essaouira are cities in Morrocco; and, Eidsvoll is a town in Norway.

questions.text: The capital of ancient Media was which of the following?
questions.explanation:
Ecbatana.

	Ecbatana was also home to the Parthian kings and was captured by Cyrus the Great in 549 BC; Edfu is in central Egypt, on the Nile; Edhessa (or alternatively Vodena) is in Macedonia; Ehrenbreitstein is an ancient fortress in Germany.

questions.text: In the Netherlands, which of the following is a city?
questions.explanation:
Eindhoven.

	Eindhoven is a beautiful city in the North Brabant province of the Netherlands, located on the Dommel River -  and my Dad was born there!  Einsiedeln is a Swiss town; Eisenach is a city in central Germany; and, Eisenhüttenstadt is a city in Germany on the Oder River.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a city in South or Central America?
questions.explanation:
El Cajon.

	El Cajon is a city in southern California, gazetted in 1912; Encarnación is a city in the south east of Paraguay; El Alto is a city in the Republic of Bolivia; and, Escazu is a city in Costa Rica.

questions.text: Which of the following was an ancient Greek city?
questions.explanation:
Eleusis.

	Eleusis was an ancient city, located north west of Athens where excavation began in 1952; Eluru is a city in central India; Elvas is a town in Portugal; and, Engels is a city in Russia, on the Volga River.

questions.text: Which of the following cities is in Turkey?
questions.explanation:
Edirne.

	Edirne is in north west Turkey and was founded around 125 AD by Hadrian; Eisenstadt is a town in Austria; Eisleben is a city in Germany; and, Engadine is a valley in Switzerland and a town in Australia!

questions.text: Of the following cities, which one is in Morocco?
questions.explanation:
El Jadida.

	El Jadida, or Al-Jadida, is a city in west Morocco, on the Atlantic Ocean, formerly called Mazagan; Elkhart is a city in the USA; Erfurt is a city in central Germany on the Gera River; and, El Tajín is a ruined pre-Columbian city in Mexico that dates back to 100 AD.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a city in Canada?
questions.explanation:
Egersund.

	Egersund is a town in southern Norway, on the North Sea; Edmonton is  on the North Saskatchewan River; Edmundston is on the Madawaska River, near the US border; and Esquimalt is in BC!

questions.text: In which country is the city of Esmeraldas?
questions.explanation:
Ecuador.

	The port city of Esmeraldas was named by Spanish explorers after the local natives who carried precious emeralds and until a few decades ago, the area around Esmeraldas was accessible only by sea.
